title: 7 Amazing Quotes From Geniuses That Changed My Life Forever
body:
## And what I learned from them

![Image by Barbara A Lane from Pixabay](https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/04/03/01/53/einstein-2197302__340.jpg)

I love good quotes.

They inspire me to reflect, take action, and learn life lessons.

Good quotes can be funny, meaningful, scary, illuminating, and fun to read.

If reflected upon and applied, these quotes can truly be life-changing.

Here are some of my favorites that have changed my life forever.

![Image by OlegForest from Pixabay](https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2020/07/12/09/29/tea-5396656__340.jpg)

> **â€œYou yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.â€**

> ***\~ The Bhudda***

We all deserve a little bit of love and if we canâ€™t love ourselves, how can we love others?

When I think about this it reminds me to do things that feel good and think of things that make me happy.

Look in the mirror, smile, and say â€˜I love you.â€™

![Image by Krzysztof Pluta from Pixabay](https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2014/07/06/16/49/auschwitz-385639__340.jpg)

> **â€œIf there is a God, he will have to beg for my forgiveness.â€**

> ***\~ Found on the wall of a German concentration camp after WW2***

It makes you wonder what type of misery and suffering humans can inflict upon each other.

The stories from some of these camps are horrendous and can send chills down your spine.

It makes you wonder how deep despair can go when you see a quote like this.

Think about your life and be grateful for both the large and the small and realize how good you really do have it compared to this poor soul.

![Image by JamesDeMers from Pixabay](https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2012/08/06/00/53/bridge-53769__340.jpg)

> **â€œThe garden of the world has no limits, except in your mind.â€**

> ***\~ Rumi***

This one reminds me that the world is filled with wonders and possibilities and is without limits.

And that the only true limitations are those which we set upon ourselves.

Realize that if one person in the world has done it, then whatever you set your mind upon you can also achieve.

Break free and believe!

![Image by Peggy und Marco Lachmann-Anke from Pixabay](https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/01/06/17/28/confucius-1124611__340.jpg)

> **â€œIt Does Not Matter How Slowly You Go as Long as You Do Not Stopâ€**

> ***\~ Confucious***

No matter how hard the journey, you can get there one small step at a time.

There truly is no rush as long as you are making progress. It is when you stop and give up that you run into problems.

Persist until you succeed, enjoy the journey, and be happy with each small step you take.

![Image byÂ Gerd AltmannÂ fromÂ PixabayÂ ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0bOtTXxoo1R3UuF8tItWI.jpg?height=1280&width=1920)

> **â€œYou have power over your mind â€” not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.â€**

> ***\~ Marcus Aurelius***

What a great quote for the current times we are living in.

Realize that the only thing you really have complete control over is your thoughts.

And once you start controlling your thoughts your start to take control over your life.

Be strong and think good, positive, loving, and courageous thoughts.

![Image byÂ Pete LinforthÂ fromÂ PixabayÂ ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tFeLBoR_KGKK-zuxCqTVw.jpg?height=1119&width=1920)

> **â€œDo you want to know who you are? Donâ€™t ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.â€**
>
> ***\~ Thomas Jefferson***

Your actions are what the world sees.

Get out in the world and take action in the direction of your goals and these acts will define how the world sees you.

What do you want to be written on your tombstone?

Act now to make it happen.

![Image by Sasin Tipchai from Pixabay](https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/11/14/03/43/buddhism-1822518__340.jpg)

> **â€œWe can never obtain peace in the outer world until we make peace with ourselves.â€**

> ***\~ The Dali Lama***

We all strive for happiness and peace in our daily lives, but many times we are left with a hole deep inside that needs to be filled.

I can remember in my early days at a Catholic mass where they exchanged the greeting, â€˜Peace be with you.â€™ and how it made me feel.

Go within and find that peaceful spot right now.

Close your eyes, take a deep breath and say â€˜Peace.â€™

# Takeaways

* Look in the mirror every morning, smile, and say â€˜I Love you.â€™
* Write 10 different things you are grateful for each day
* Remove all limits and know that whatever the human mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.
* Take one small step towards your goal each day and never stop. Persist until you succeed.
* Think courageous thoughts like â€˜I can do itâ€™ every night before bed and know that you have the power to control your mind.
* Take action on the things that really matter and build a legacy.
* Go within whenever the world becomes too much to handle and find your peaceful place.

I hope these quotes have helped you and given you something to think about.

Use them to change your life in small, but profound ways.

title: Blockchain origin, concept definition, development history?
body:
The origin of the voice Â 

Blockchain originated from Bitcoin. On November 1, 2008, a person claiming to be Satoshi Nakamoto published bitcoin: A peer-to-peer electronic cash System \[4\].Â Â Based on P2P network technology, encryption technology, time stamp technology, blockchain technology and other electronic cash system architecture concept, which marks the birth of Bitcoin.Â Â Two months later, the theory was put into practice. On January 3, 2009, the first Trands block with serial number 0 was born.Â Â A few days later, on January 9, 2009, block numbered 1 appeared and was connected with Trands Block numbered 0 to form a chain, marking the birth of block chain \[5\]. Â 

In recent years, the world's attitude toward bitcoin has waxed and waned, but blockchain technology, one of bitcoin's underlying technologies, is gaining traction.Â Â During the formation of Bitcoin, blocks are storage units that record all communication between each block node over a period of time.Â Â Each block is linked by random hashing (also known as hash algorithm), and the latter block contains the hash value of the previous block. With the expansion of information exchange, one block is connected with another block, and the result is called blockchain \[6\]. Â 

Concept definition speech Â 

What is blockchain?Â Â In terms of technology, blockchain involves math, cryptography, the Internet, computer programming and many other scientific and technological issues.Â Â From an application perspective, to put it simply, blockchain is a distributed shared ledger and database that is decentralized, tamper-free, whole-process traces, traceable, collectively maintained, and open and transparent.Â Â These features ensure the "honesty" and "transparency" of blockchain and lay the foundation for creating trust in blockchain.Â Â However, the rich application scenarios of blockchain are basically based on the fact that blockchain can solve the problem of information asymmetry and realize collaboration trust and concerted action between multiple subjects \[7\]. Â 

Blockchain is a new application mode of distributed data storage, point-to-point transmission, consensus mechanism, encryption algorithm and other computer technologies.Â Â Blockchain is an important concept of Bitcoin. In essence, it is a decentralized database. At the same time, as the underlying technology of Bitcoin, it is a string of data blocks associated with the use of cryptography.Â Â It is used to verify the validity of its information (anti-counterfeiting) and generate the next block \[8\]. Â 

\[4\] The term blockchain does not actually appear, but instead uses chain of blocks.Â Â In the earliest Chinese translation of bitcoin white paper \[9\], chain of Blocks was translated into blockchain.Â Â This is the earliest time that the Chinese word "blockchain" appeared. Â 

The Cyberspace Administration of China issued the Provisions on the Management of Blockchain Information Services on January 10, 2019, which will come into force on February 15, 2019 \[1\]. Â 

As an important breakthrough of independent innovation of core technology, the security risk of blockchain is regarded as a major shortcoming restricting the healthy development of the industry. Frequent security incidents ring the alarm bell for the industry.Â Â To embrace blockchain, it is necessary to speed up the exploration and establishment of a security guarantee system adapted to the mechanism of blockchain technology.Â Â \[10\] Â 

Development history phonology Â 

Â 

The concept of blockchain was first proposed by Satoshi Nakamoto in 2008 \[4\]. In the following years, blockchain has become a core component of bitcoin, the electronic currency: as a public ledger for all transactions.Â Â By leveraging peer-to-peer networks and distributed timestamp servers, blockchain databases can be managed autonomously.Â Â The blockchain invented for Bitcoin made it the first digital currency to solve the problem of repeated spending.Â Â Bitcoin's design has become a source of inspiration for other apps. Â 

In 2014, "blockchain 2.0" became a term for a decentralized blockchain database.Â Â For this second-generation programmable blockchain, economists see it as a programming language that allows users to write more sophisticated and intelligent protocols \[11\].Â Â Therefore, when the profit reaches a certain level, the profit can be obtained from the distribution of completed shipping orders or shared certificates.Â Â Blockchain 2.0 technology skips transactions and "intermediaries that act as arbitrators of money and information in the exchange of value".Â Â They are used to insulate people from the globalised economy, to protect privacy, to "monetise information" and to ensure that owners of intellectual property benefit.Â Â The second generation of blockchain technology makes it possible to store a person's "permanent digital ID and image" and provide a solution to the "underlying social wealth distribution" inequality \[12\]. Â 

On January 20, 2016, the People's Bank of China digital Currency Seminar announced that the research on digital currency has achieved phased results.Â Â The meeting affirmed the value of digital currencies in reducing the issuance of traditional currencies, and said the central bank is exploring the issuance of digital currencies.Â Â The expression of the People's Bank of China digital currency seminar greatly enhanced the confidence of the digital currency industry.Â Â This is the first time that the central bank has expressed a clear attitude towards the digital currency after five ministries and commissions of the CENTRAL bank issued a notice on preventing bitcoin risks on December 5, 2013.Â Â \[13\] Â 

On December 20, 2016, digital Currency Alliance -- China FinTech Digital Currency Alliance and FinTech Research Institute were officially established \[14\]. Â 

Nowadays, Bitcoin is still the absolute mainstream of digital currency. Digital currency presents a state of a hundred flowers blooming, common ones include Bitcoin, Litecoin, Dogecoin and Dashcoin. In addition to currency applications, there are also various derivative applications.Â Â Underlying application development platforms such as Ethereum, Ethereum and Asch, as well as industry applications such as NXT, SIA, Bitstock, MaidSafe and Ripple \[15\]. title: Most B2B enterprises are still traditional sales model
body:
The private domain everyone talks about, the simple and crude idea is to bring in potential customers first and then run the business.
B2B industry is also afraid of falling behind, so many experts began to preach. But I believe that no company has done particularly well so far, otherwise why the examples are still perfect diary, Xibei... Talking about members, super users...
However, in addition to tools or products with low customer unit price, most decisions of B2B enterprises are more complex and have many processes, so the sales method is still traditional. The main reasons are as follows:

1. It takes time to change the customer's mind
   Most intuitively, it is not realistic for large and medium-sized enterprises to change the relationship that can be maintained only by drinking, singing K, playing ball games and picking up children into online care and operation.
   The common membership, points, discounts and so on in the B2C industry are of no use to corporate customers. In front of bidding and bidding, this small favor is nothing.
   Of course, traditions are also changing.
   For example, different departments within the enterprise are increasingly communicating and interacting directly with customers. Some enterprises for customers to establish "a customer a group" or "a customer N internal group", technology, pre-sale, after-sales all-round service.
   Some enterprises also establish customer communities, such as technical community, to let customers participate in feedback or even product optimization, insight into customer needs, faster response and service.
2. If there is no rigid demand, there will be no procurement
   B2C demand can be stimulated by the level of product appearance, vanity, curiosity and so on, but NOT B2B, no demand, no purchase, this is the naked reality.
   B2B marketing teams may be able to turn potential problems into requirements through initial contact with customers, understanding requirements, and guiding customers to new products and solutions at appropriate opportunities.
   This process from excavation, incubation and transformation to sales may take a long time and requires digital means to manage, which is also the fundamental logic of SCRM now.
3. It's not up to B2B users
   Can B2B learn B2C? Of course, because the decision makers are people. But the biggest difference is that B2B decision makers and users are often not one person or a group of people.
   Especially for those enterprises that need financial approval to buy a ruler or a stapler, it is a little difficult to change into a user-led purchase.
   But users can influence decision makers, such as more shareable content, peer cases, industry white papers, and so on.

title: The heart of customer service is the same fundamental?
body:
All this is just the tip of the B2B iceberg.Â From customer acquisition to accurate operation to contract operation and maintenance, the cycle is long, so it is necessary to have a solid insight into demand and do a good job in products and services.

No matter what concept is used, be it SCRM or private domain, accurate portraits of customers are required, and multiple effective contacts are made in digital form to create better customer experience.

A few years ago, I visited a B2B listed company. The Marketing Department of this company focused on business opportunity transformation more than 10 years ago.

Therefore, their initial practice is that the Marketing Department obtains potential customers through activities and operates them through wechat and email.

For example, a marketing person follows 2000 customers, and his daily work is also dealing with these 2000 customers.Â It's not a small number, so you have to sort it out, what industry, what size company, what customer role...

But the most powerful is not this, in touch to do heart and differentiation.Â For example, we can not use the template email mode, but the sincere email prepared by ourselves, including holiday wishes, product use survey, market activity invitation, product training meeting...Â Customers can feel the real care, and is related to their own, close.

It was a bit tiring to run, but slowly it paid off.

A few years later, marketing represented 50% of the company's potential opportunities.Â Later, the company gradually used more advanced data analysis and processing tools, and everyone became more efficient, more and more valuable to the business, and customer satisfaction was also on the rise.

So, you don't have to rely on tools to do digital marketing well.Â One of the most critical or customers really as customers, rather than data or traffic, heart service.

This is all too easy to say, but how difficult it is to do.

Providing accurate content, products and services is the embodiment of the competitiveness of B2B enterprises.

So no matter what borrows concepts, or what introduces new technologies and tools, the essence of marketing remains the same - meeting customer needs.

With the support of digital means, enterprises can understand customers more accurately, help customers solve business problems more quickly, and provide more thoughtful services and support.

These are the ultimate answers to the growth question, and the answer has never changed.

title: B2B business customer experience journey?
body:
I also know that a lot of people talk about the private domain, just to borrow the concept.Â Actually, I want to talk about SCRM or CDP\\DMP, the concept of digital marketing.

So when they say private, they're really talking about the broader customer experience.

For example, we must keep continuous communication with the customers we contacted before, even though we did not purchase. When the customers have demands, we must think of them at the first time.

There may be customers poached by competitors, because of frequent contact, one day when the customer does not want a single brand, think of it again;

For those who purchased a product many years ago and have passed the free operation and maintenance period, through long-term interaction, customers may buy again or cross purchase other products;

Existing customers may also share good purchasing and use experiences with others.

In addition, the complexity of B2B is that the matching of enterprise information and personal information, decision tree, purchase situation, etc., are dynamic.

Most of these data are scattered, so the need for system management and operation, hence the booming development of digital marketing technology (Martech).

title: What's new about 2022 New consumption?
body:
What is a "new" product? Let's take an example, new energy vehicles VS fuel cars.
At first, many traditional car manufacturers thought that Tesla was an electric car and that we could become a new force in the automobile industry by changing the fuel system to an electric one.
Then it became clear that Tesla's essence was not an "electric car" at all, but an "intelligent mobile terminal". Tesla doesn't sell cars, it sells technology services.
For the automotive field, "new energy vehicles" is not a new product, "intelligent mobile terminal" is the real new product.
Similarly, in the consumer goods world, if you make a replacement or an upgrade, you're not really a new consumer product at all.
For example, traditional consumer goods are mainly oversold in stores, while you are selling through emerging channels such as Douyin Xiaohongshu Live. This kind of replacement or upgrade can be easily achieved with traditional consumer goods.
As I said in the "New" Scam of New Consumer Goods, the so-called "new crowd", "new products", "new media" and "new channels" of new consumer goods are all "fake new".
The reason why new consumer goods can be called new consumer goods is that the "way of driving growth" is different from traditional consumer goods. If new consumer goods do not find new ways to drive growth, the rest of the "new" is just skin deep.
Today, we will disassemble a very important topic: where is the new consumption?
Who is the "elephant" in new consumption?
In the field of new consumer goods, an interesting phenomenon is that it is very easy for a brand to go from 0-1 and easily achieve sales of 100 million +, but it is extremely difficult to go from 1-100. For 95% of new consumer goods, there is no path and no hope to break the one billion mark.
The world of new consumer goods is a world of quick life and quick death, a world of ants and no elephants.
The only "elephant" is a very low-key enterprise named Shein.
A quick look at the brand through a set of descriptions:

1. Shein's revenue in 2020 is $65 billion, equivalent to 1.5 Uniqlo stores;
2. Shein is a cross-border fast fashion e-commerce company that buys clothes in 220 countries around the world, but its headquarters is in Nanjing, China;
3. Shein has about 120 million registered users, ranking first in 56 countries in the Apple App Store;
4. Shein was founded 13 years ago, last valued at $47 billion, and has been growing at more than 100% every year.
   Shein is low-key because you won't see the company in almost any coverage until 2020. Everyone from the Wall Street Journal to Chinese Business weeklies missed the e-commerce giant.
   Although many new consumer brands have created a big topic on the Internet in recent years, it is this seemingly low-key brand that really leads the new consumer wave.
   Shein leads the new wave of consumption, and young girls overseas are addicted to Shein like Douyin. Shein opened its first store in Miami, and 125 people came into the store every hour in the first three days...
   On the surface, Shein is the online version of Zara, taking the fast fashion route. All fast fashion brands have two characteristics: one is cheap, one is fast on the new speed.
   Shein's popularity was first attributed to its outrageous price tag. $7 hoodies, $12 dresses, $17 jeans;
   Shein outperformed LAN in the new speed. In general, uniqlo takes six months to update, Zara takes 14 days, and Shein takes seven days.
   If you log in to Shein, the words "new 1000+ daily" are prominently displayed. Moreover, Shein's interface is more like Xiaohongshu than Taobao, with a large number of new styles + information flow interface, which can keep girls scrolling.
   What exactly is Shein? Cheaper than Amazon, faster than Zara, more choice than Vipshop and as indulged as Tiktok, that's Shein.
   The question is, how does it all work?
   All clothing business, the biggest pain point is: how to grasp the trend? When consumers buy a piece of clothing, they have already passed the stage of quality selection. What we value is the aesthetic temperament expressed by design, tailoring and materials.
   If the trend is wrong, the clothes produced will not be bought, and the unmarketable clothes will be overstocked and sold at a discount. Moreover, there is a long lead time between fashion prediction and product hitting the shelves. If the production cycle is too long, the tide will pass.
   The reason why fast fashion brands beat traditional clothing brands is that Uniqlo, Zara and HM have solved this problem.
   Fast fashion brands grasp the trend of the way is a word - copy. Pick all the hot styles of the big brands this season, and then refer to the design of the big brands for "optimization".
   Then, according to different design styles, they will first produce some clothing orders in small batches, put them in the store to see the sales performance, and then place additional orders to the factory for the clothes that sell well. This mode is called "quick return of small orders" in the industry.
   The reason why Shein's new speed catches up with Zara and other traditional fast fashion companies is that Shein has connected front-end sales and back-end factories in a digital way.
   First, Shein will grab the data of the whole network to predict the trend of clothing.
   Shein usually uses Google's Trend Finder tool to track all clothing products online and analyze the fabric, style, color, pattern and other information of clothing. At the same time, it will also grab the user's search terms on clothing. Changes in search terms plus changes in the clothing itself constitute Shein's algorithm map.
   In 2018, Shein reportedly used this logic to successfully predict lace in summer and cotton in India.
   Shein then guesses the fashion trends of the next season based on these data, and then makes a large number of orders for the goods, which are put on the shelves for sales testing.
   Zara can test about six items at a time, while Shein can test 30 items at a time. And burst rate in 50%, unsalable rate of 10%.
   Shein's APP is more like Xiaohongshu than Taobao, with a large number of new styles + information flow style products, allowing users to indulge in the ocean of buying and buying.
   So Shein has a lot of data on consumer behavior. Shein can then use one party's data on its own site to continuously calibrate previous third-party data.
   First, Shein integrates e-commerce data with factory data, allowing factories to directly add orders for popular products and adjust the output of different products.
   Second, let the design team modify the products that are not selling well and remix the fashion elements until they become hits.
   To accomplish all these, Shein needs not excellent designers, supply chain talents or e-commerce operators, but a huge team of big data and algorithms. It is said that Shein has recruited a technical team of about several hundred people in Shenzhen to be responsible for Shein's big data analysis and algorithm recommendation.
   As a result, Shein is more like "Douyin of clothing," a real new consumer company that uses big data and algorithms to transform traditional industries.
   I guess that the upcoming "Douyin E-commerce" will also refer to or even simulate Shein's business model and challenge the traditional e-commerce with Alibaba, JINGdong and Vipshop as the core.
   If I had to find a representative of "new" consumption, I think Shein is it. Because Shein is "new", it has found a new way to drive growth, rather than just using a new tool or optimizing a business segment.
   Shein may not represent a new consumer industry, but it is a clothing brand and an e-commerce platform. But there's a basic lesson to be learned from Shein:
   Only by innovating your business model can you become a new species. You have a chance to topple a seemingly impossible industry giant.
   Douyin eclipsed IQiyi Youku not because short videos are newer and better than long ones, but because Douyin short videos are essentially a technology company and IQiyi Youku is essentially a content company.
   Apple beat Nokia not because apple's phone is better looking and has a better experience, but because Apple is a mobile smart terminal and Nokia is still a mobile phone.
   In the same way, if a new consumer brand is to truly lead the consumer wave, it must find new growth-driven models, not better packaging, younger demographics, newer channels and edgier marketing.
   The "new" of new consumer goods should be "innovative" rather than "old and new". In my view, there are three things that distinguish truly new and traditional consumer goods:
5. Unidirectional vs. bidirectional channels
6. Dot vs. mesh
7. Buying traffic vs. generative traffic
   One-way channel VS two-way channel
   This new consumption wave is more like a big explosion of new consumer categories, with many small and rare consumer categories popping up. Like these:
   A. Hair and makeup
   B. Fashion makeup for girls
   C. Coconut light
   Aromatherapy skin care
   E. Oriental fragrance
   F. Sleep environment brand
   Countless new consumer products emerge, most of which tend to keep consumers fresh for a while and fade after a year or two.
   The new consumer goods are like the idol trainees of that year, and the idols of that year are regarded as "annual cast idols" by their fans. The fate of most new consumer goods is the same as idol, become our annual sales products.
   This is a big challenge for us to start a business, that is, it is difficult for us to grasp consumer demand. "Hard to grasp" does not mean that we cannot discern consumer needs, but that consumers' "demand cycles" are becoming shorter and their "demand types" more fragmentary.
   In my opinion, it is hard for the next Wong Lo Kat and six walnuts to emerge at present, and it is hard for enterprises that rely on large single product strategy to succeed today.
   In those days, when Wong Lo Kat launched herbal tea, there were only imitators and no competitors trying to innovate the category of herbal tea.
   But now? An entrepreneur may have just developed a lime tea, and soon there will be a variety of flavor innovations: sweet lime, fragrant lime, green lime, hand whipped lime...
   In other words, the lead time brought by "category innovation" is getting shorter and shorter.
   The presence of imitators is not necessarily a bad thing, it shows that the category is promising, and the more players come in, the sooner the market ripens. What's really scary is that more "category innovation" keeps popping up, making your new category suddenly old and less unusual.
   As requirements iteration speeds up and product life cycles shorten, traditional business models begin to weaken.
   In the past, consumer goods entrepreneurship is to produce their own products, and then put the products in the store, and then through advertising and marketing for consumption tips, and finally when consumers use the after-sales service.
   The traditional business chain goes like this:
   The biggest problem with this business chain is that it is a one-way road. If any link fails, the rest cannot be sustained.
   In the current consumer environment, a new product may just be introduced to jiangsu and Zhejiang markets, but even before it starts to spread nationwide, there will be more innovative products. We start to question ourselves, should we continue with the product we have, or should we introduce the newer product?
   Again, we pull back to Shein's business model.
   Shein's business chain has not changed, but what is different is that the traditional business chain is a "one-way channel", while Shein's business chain is a "two-way channel".
   In Shein's business chain, the sales end can provide data feedback to the production end, so that the production end can better control the ever-changing needs of users.
   What is the biggest difference between a one-way channel and a two-way channel? The "one-way channel" business model can only pursue a "static" business model.
   The "two-way channel" because of continuous data feedback, so its product, selection, sales mode, service mode, can be based on the client data of continuous iteration, is a "dynamic" business model.
   You may think that Shein can do this because it is essentially an e-commerce platform rather than a consumer product, and it belongs to the clothing industry and has many SKUs.
   But let's recall whether the entrepreneurial logic of Yuanqi Forest is somewhat similar to Shein's logic.
   Each media once advocated that Yuanqi Forest is "making products just like making apps" : it will first launch A series of products in different categories or different flavors of the same category, and then take them to the regional market for A/B test. Whichever product and flavor can stand out, it will push forward in the future.
   The big difference between this approach and traditional business, where decisions are made entirely by people, is that we rely directly on data feedback and market effects to make decisions. But Yuanqi Forest does not have its own stores, nor does it have its own e-commerce platform, and its grasp of big data and algorithms is much worse.
   The essence of "two-way channel" is to digitize offline services. Let the user's consumer behavior into data, fast feedback to the production and marketing end, forming a decision-making loop.
   Dot brand VS mesh brand
   The vast majority of new consumer products don't have brands at all, they just look good. The design of product packaging is good-looking, and the brand words are written with a sense of network. This is not called a brand, but a "skin".
   A lot of traditional consumable is vulgar mediocre, a lot of new consumable is beautiful mediocre, both do not have how many difference.
   Is there a difference in the way new consumer goods are branded versus traditional consumer goods?
   Traditional consumer goods follow the pattern of finding an identity for a brand and then occupying it by penetrating the consumer's mind through saturation advertising.
   I call this kind of brand "point brand", because the real valuable asset of a brand is almost a slogan, which the brand tries to pin into the heart of consumer goods in communication.
   Traditional brands believe in "domineering", I don't care whether you like me or not, as long as I can occupy your attention, you can only hold me in your life.
   But this approach is becoming less effective today, as "centralised media" is dying and all media is evolving towards "a thousand faces". Brands, especially new brands, should not attempt to dominate the minds of consumers, without the environment and budget.
   The new generation of brand, can no longer believe in "domineering", to believe in "king's way". "Hegemony" and "kingship" may both be able to establish a state, but the difference is that "hegemony" can not care about the people, while "kingship" depends on the people to win the world.
   Therefore, the current brand building is not to occupy the user's mind, but to create the possibility of "being linked". Let users sincerely support your brand, in order to achieve great achievements.
   From "occupy" to "be linked", the brand of play to change.

title: How to build brand house?
body:
Building brand house is the basic ability of brand strategy people.

In front of many brand directors/managers, one question I often ask is "What do you think of branded homes?"Â .

This position not only tests the overall control of the brand, but also evaluates the strategic thinking, and requires independent thinking.

Because this question is relatively macro, we can know the system ability of the interviewer from this question itself.

The so-called strategy is market insight based on the underlying system.

When we say branded house, what are we really talking about?

The full name of Brand House is Brand Message House, which is both internal positioning and external communication.Â When we say brand house, we are really talking about effective communication of strategic message.

What brand house is important, but fundamentally lies in its internal logic, what is the rationality of its existence.

Before you know anything, you must know the meaning of its existence.

The trend of things lies in the underlying logic of their existence.Â Brand house is also the same, internal organization is leading, external information is unified.

Internal organization.

The construction of brand is the result of organization and coordination. A great brand needs the efforts of all the organizations of the company.Â As CMO or brand director, on the basis of company strategy, we need to find the focal point of information from the source of business (brand undertaking track), and find the output point of information from consumer insight (brand orientation to consumers).

External information unification.

What a brand does determines who you are in the consumer's mind.Â All propagating activities should be reasonably paced within the proper range.Â CMO or brand director, before you do brand control, you need to know what the standards are.

We try to carry out fine division, find the underlying logic of brand house.

Since the brand house is a house, it has its own structure.Â From strategy to tactics, from roof to bottom, we divide it into four sections: mental occupation, interest expression, argument support and product provision.

These four sections are gradually advancing, echoing each other to achieve the effect of brand strategy management.

The mind occupied

Brand positioning from market positioning, occupy the market is to win the hearts of the people.Â The dividend of the heart is the dividend of the market.Â Therefore, the occupation of the mind is an important way of brand development.

Brand positioning: for whom (target consumers)?Â What category do you belong to?Â Solve what problem?Â What can be achieved?Â Because you have reason 1/2/3 (RTB system).

The category here, namely the consumer demand category, is the customer logic, rather than divorced from the so-called imagined market logic or factory logic.

Brand proposition: brand proposition provides customers with functional value, emotional value and self-expression value.Â Effective value proposition is the way to drive the brand to establish customer relationship.

Brand tonality: what kind of impression does this brand insist on in the process of communication?

Brand slogan: is to convey brand concept, long-term communication with consumers slogan.Â Brand is the brand dimension, conveys the brand concept or product selling point.Â Slogan is a communicative dimension, short and provocative pep talk.Â Long-term is the implementation dimension, refers to a long time, repeated use.

Positioning is the foundation, with positioning, there will be advocated value propositions.Â Based on brand positioning or brand characteristics, there will be brand tonality, with the expression of brand positioning, there will be brand slogan communication.

Interest expression

Brands originate from customer needs, products solve problems and provide consumer benefits.Â Brand positioning is rooted in consumer demand, and interest expression is oriented to "consumer solutions".

Core target audience: products serve demand, demand from the crowd.Â The core target group here is not as detailed as the user portrait, mainly determined age, gender, social role.

Interest points are divided into functional interest and emotional interest, functional interest is the category itself, to solve the physical needs.Â Emotional benefit is a category of consumer meaning, or brand in this big consumer meaning itself on a subdivision.

Arguments to support

The argument is the RTB system, why are you believed?

Who you are, brand positioning, why you can be who, is the support of the argument.Â From the perspective of skin care products, RTB (Reason To Believe) is mainly the core technology and main ingredient.

Products provide

Under the origin of brand positioning, what series of products do you have? These series are mainly from the point of view of product selling points or related configurations.

Brand positioning is not empty talk, need its products to answer.Â The former describes what they are, the latter what they can do.

Product matrix is not just a combination of multiple products, but also together to consolidate the brand positioning.

Here's an example:

Â Â 

Conclusion:

We should not brand house for brand house's sake. The house is shape, and the communication is god.Â Brand house expresses not only the strategic power of the enterprise, but also the tactical power of communication.

Brand house is one of the effective means of strategy leading ability of brand strategy people.Â It is not only the "take" of brand positioning and expression, but also the "give up" in the process of taking.

title: Do you have these five cognitive biases?
body:
Researchers in cognitive science, social psychology, and behavioral economics have been studying cognitive bias for decades.
These biases have to do with the way we think and act, and can lead to all kinds of problems in starting a business, investing or managing.
Examples of cognitive biases include familiarity bias, attribution bias, and anchoring bias.
The human brain is capable of incredible things, but it is also sometimes profoundly flawed.
Science shows that we tend to make a variety of thinking errors, called "cognitive biases," that affect how we think and act. These biases can lead us to infer information from the wrong sources, always try to confirm existing beliefs, or even fail to reconstruct the truth of events!
Yes, it's part of human nature -- but this cognitive bias can have profound effects on our careers, investments, and lives in general.
What is cognitive bias?
Humans tend to think in certain ways, which can lead to systematic biases in rational judgments.
These tendencies often arise from:
Information processing short circuit
The limited processing power of the brain
Emotion and moral motivation
Distortions in memory storage and recall
Social influence
Researchers in cognitive science, social psychology and behavioral economics have studied cognitive biases for decades, but they are actually particularly important in today's information-rich world. They affect the way we think and act, and this irrational mind-set can lead to all kinds of problems in starting a business, investing, or managing.
For instance,
Here are five examples of how different types of prejudice affect people in business:

1. Familiarity bias: An investor invests her money in "what she knows" rather than seeking the obvious benefits of portfolio diversification. Just because you are familiar with a certain type of industry or security doesn't make it a logical choice.
2. Attribution bias: Entrepreneurs excessively attribute their company's success to themselves rather than other factors (team, luck, industry trends). And when things go downhill, he blames these external factors for holding back his progress.
3. Anchoring bias: Employees in salary negotiations rely too much on the first number mentioned in the negotiation, rather than rationally examining a range of options.
4. Survivor bias: Starting a business seems easy because there are so many successful entrepreneurs in the world. However, this is a cognitive bias: successful entrepreneurs are seen, but millions of failed ones are not.
5. The gambler's Fallacy: A venture capitalist sees a portfolio company repeatedly rise in value after its IPO by far less than he originally expected. Instead of holding winners and rationally assessing the likelihood of further appreciation, he sold stocks to lock in existing gains.

title: What is cognitive ability? Meaning and Definitionï¼Ÿ
body:
What is cognition?Â The word comes from the Latin root cognoscere, meaning 'to know'.Â When we talk about cognition, we usually mean everything related to knowledge.Â In other words, we have accumulated information through learning and experience.

Cognition, by its accepted definition, is the ability to process information through perception (that is, we get stimuli through different senses) and is an important process of acquiring knowledge, while our subjective features enable us to integrate all this information into the analysis and interpretation of our world.Â In other words, cognition is what we perceive about ourselves from different sources (perception, experience, belief......)Â The ability to absorb and process received information and convert it into knowledge.Â Cognition includes the different cognitive processes of learning, attention, memory, language, reasoning, decision-making, etc., and is an important part of shaping our intellectual development.

Study cognition from different disciplines, such as neurology, psychology, anthropology, philosophy, and even information science.Â However, the in-depth study of cognitive psychology is the study of how to deal with the influence of information on behavior and the relationship with the acquisition of knowledge in different mental processes.Â Cognitive psychology emerged in the late 1950s in opposition to popular behaviorism.Â The revolutionary scientific theories of writers such as Piaget and Vigotsky and their research on cognitive learning are still relevant today.Â Since the '60s, people have been more and more interested in studying cognitive ability, which is why we have so many results.

Advances in neuroimaging have contributed to the study of neuroanatomy and our understanding of mental processes and how they affect our behavior and emotions.

What is cognition?

Cognitive processes

What is the cognitive process?Â We can think of it as a cognitive process in which we make decisions and understand based on all knowledge or new knowledge.Â Different cognitive functions play different roles in these processes: perception, attention, memory, reasoning......Â Each of these cognitive functions works together to integrate new knowledge and create interpretations of the world around us.

Perception as a cognitive process: Cognitive perception allows us to organize and understand stimuli received through our different senses, such as sight, hearing, taste, smell, and touch.Â While most are familiar with common sense, there are a few others that are less well known about sensation, spatial sensation (the involuntary sensation of our position in space and the stimulation of spatial orientation) and vocal sensation (which is our sense of organs in our bodies).Â What it is can let us know when we are hungry, or thirsty.Â Once the stimulus is received, our brain integrates all the information and creates a new memory.

Attention is a cognitive process: Attention is a stimulus that allows us to focus on cognitive processes or activities in order to process information more thoroughly.Â Attention is a basic cognitive function that we use a lot in our daily lives.Â In fact, it is thought to be the mechanism that controls and regulates the rest of the cognitive process: perception (we need to be aware that we must be able to exclude stimuli received by our senses) in order to learn and reason complex.

Memory as a cognitive process: Memory is the cognitive function that allows us to process, store, and recover information from the past.Â Memory is a fundamental process of learning because it is the ability to create our sense of identity.Â There are many types of memory, such as short-term memory, which is the ability to retain information for a short time (remember a phone number until we can write it down on paper), and long-term memory, which is all we retain for a long period of time.Â Long-term memory can be broken down into more specific, declarative and procedural memories.Â Declarative memory includes information gained through language and education (e.g., knowing that World War II ended in 1945), knowledge gained, and knowledge gained from personal experience (remember that my grandmother used to make it for me).Â Procedural memory is when there are learning routines (learning how to drive a car or ride a bike).Â Other types of memory are auditory memory, episodic memory, naming, and recognition.

Thinking is a cognitive process: thought is the foundation of all cognitive processes.Â It enables us to integrate all the information we have received and establish relationships between events and knowledge.Â To do this, it uses reasoning, synthesis, and problem-solving (administrative) capabilities.

The process of language cognition: Language is the ability to express our thoughts and feelings orally.Â This is the tool we use to communicate, organize and deliver information about ourselves and the world.Â Language and thinking are closely related, they influence each other and develop together.

Learning is thought of as a cognitive process: it is the cognitive process we use to combine new information with our existing knowledge.Â Learning involves different things and so on. We develop social behaviors or habits by learning, like brushing our teeth or walking, and memorizing knowledge.Â Piaget and other writers talk about learning as a process by which our cognitive system takes in and processes information.

Cognitive processes

Cognitive processes can occur naturally or artificially, consciously or unconsciously, but they often develop very quickly, constantly trying to improve without achieving the desired outcome.Â For example, when we walk down the street and we see traffic lights turn red, we begin to generate cognitive processes that tell us what to do (pass or not pass).Â The first thing we did was to focus our attention on the traffic light, which was red by sight.Â In milliseconds, we draw information from our memory that when a traffic light is red, you should not pass;Â But we also remember that sometimes, if there is no car then we can pass.Â This gives us a decision: wait until the light turns green to pass, or look left and right (again to divert our attention) to see if there is a car coming, and pass when there is none.

Can cognitive abilities be improved?

Is it possible to improve cognition?Â How to improve it?Â Here we show you a tool to enhance and improve your cognitive abilities:

CogniFit's cognitive stimulation program was designed by a team of neurologists and cognitive psychologists to investigate the plasticity of learning synapses and the processes of neural development.Â All you need (2-3 times a week) is 15 minutes to stimulate your cognitive processes.Â : The program can be used online and then has specific plans for individuals, researchers, health professionals and schools.

CogniFit's cognitive stimulation exercises effectively assess over 20 basic cognitive functions, accurately test against objectives and provide different age-standard levels, and compare standard levels based on results.

Different interactive exercises come in the form of puzzle games that you can practice on your computer.Â After each training, CogniFit presents a detailed picture of the user's evolving cognitive state and how it compares to other users' cognitive functions.Â CogniFit online clinical exercises have been shown to promote the reorganization of new synapses and neural circuits and restore cognitive function in deteriorated cognitive areas.

Neuroscience and the plasticity of the brain have shown us that the more you use neural circuits, the stronger the brain's neural circuits are.Â CogniFit's cognitive stimulation program helps explore our cognitive processes.Â Only when we understand each person's cognitive state can we provide them with personalized cognitive training programs.Â Focusing on the most challenging tasks, making sure we're creating and building new neural connections, the brain is getting stronger as a result of training.

Can you improve your cognitive level?

Reduce stress levels: Stress increases cortisol levels, while attacking axons and myelin sheaths block effective transmission of information.Â If we can reduce stress in our lives, we may be able to improve our cognition, because reducing stress improves synaptic connections.Â Keeping a positive attitude makes us more creative in solving problems and makes our thinking more flexible.

Meditate: Meditation can also help us improve our cognition.Â In the past few years, there has been increasing research into the effects of meditation on cognitive processes.Â Because it requires conscious focus and attention on a task, as we said, is an important skill for creating new neural network connections.Â This study demonstrates that meditation is involved in improvements in attention, memory, executive function, increased reaction times, and general cognitive function.

Physical Activity: Exercise to improve cognition.Â It doesn't have to be particularly intense.Â In fact, walking for 45 minutes three times a week improved memory and reasoning (administrative functions), and tai chi also improved key executive functions.

title: We media article title how to write to attract attention? These 8 must-see tips for Newcomers?
body:
Today we share, how to title, to more attractive? A number of clicks on the article, is inseparable from a moving title, how to play a good title? A lot of people have said that, but there are always people who can't, right? Today I will talk to you again!
First of all, I need to know the mistake of the title:

1. The title completely reflects the theme
   Many writers will appear this situation, feel that the title is to show the theme of the article, reflect the main content, however, we have an important aspect of the title, it is ignored, that is to attract the eye, if only monotonous show the theme, it will not attract the eye effect.
   2, lack of reading
   A readable headline is one that makes the reader want to read the whole article, not one that makes the reader want to read the whole article.
2. Never make headlines
   The title is seriously inconsistent with the content of the article. In order to increase the click rate, a grandiose title is created, but the content of the article has no connection with the title. This is cheating readers.
   Secondly, these are the aspects we should consider when writing the title:
   1, the title should pay attention to objective facts, not grandiose, to be easy to understand, consider our article audience level, understanding ability, not too obscure, especially rare words to avoid as far as possible.
   2, a suspense title let us see the title at the beginning of the mind with a question, want to read the article to solve the problem, a suspense title is easier to attract the attention of readers.
   3, the purpose of the title, directly describe the details of the article, such a title is suitable for teaching articles, let readers know what you want to teach at a glance, want to learn people know is not their own needs to meet the knowledge and skills needs of readers.
3. Contradictory and controversial titles
   Use conflicting arguments to engage readers directly in the debate, but articles with such titles need to be good content and worth reading.
4. Hot event titles
   Hot events are always the easiest for people to chase after, and the flow can not be underestimated. Actively mastering the dynamics of public opinion and always paying attention to hot news events are beneficial for us to write articles.
5. The Angle of the title
   Articles on the same topic can be divided into different sub-categories. For example, when we write about agriculture, rural areas and farmers, we can start to describe them from different aspects. A novel perspective and a distinct attitude will have different contents from others.
6. Use "I", "you" and "TA"
   Use the first, second, third person to write the title, with the story to move people, from the beginning directly hit the reader's mind, to achieve the title effect.
7. The number of title words is also critical
   A longer title can put down more eye-catching words, of course, also can not be a long title, there is a topic skill is split, the key words of the article listed first, take a look to remove the most critical, the rest of the combination, see the result is not the title you want!

title: 1SWIPEAWAY
body:
**I think it hit me at some point during the Uber ride to her house: this could be the most important hook-up in human history. And the scariest. I know it sounds stupid and indulgent to say that, especially coming from another hetero-normative dude in black Christian Diors like me. (Whatever, they were knock-offs.) But given the extraordinary features of this interaction, along with its consequences for how people think of themselves, I really donâ€™t think itâ€™s an exaggeration. All of this is true by the way. I donâ€™t have the time to make any of this up, and frankly I sucked pretty bad in Language Arts. My grade-school teachers will bug out if they read this.**

**My band was doing a show in Salt Lake Cityâ€“you know, Mormon utopia in the middle of the desert. Our next gig in Boise had been cancelled for reasons we didnâ€™t entirely understand. When youâ€™re on the road you just kind of run with things, I guess. We decided to hang out in Utah for a couple of days. Somebody said we could â€œbackpack in the watercolor meadows of the Uintahsâ€. Sounded like a good time. We do retrowave electronica stuff, lots of synthy sounds with flashing lights and voice effects. Everyoneâ€™s into the eighties again, even the Mormons it turns out.**

**I still donâ€™t think of myself as a hook-up guy, even after all these years on the road. Iâ€™m serious. Itâ€™s not something I enjoy or even particularly like. I see hook-ups as one of the rites of being a traveling musician, or maybe even a curse. Itâ€™s like how prime ministers have to shake hands with people they donâ€™t necessarily like. Iâ€™m a reluctant diplomat of the grunge scene. Everything that guys like David Bowie did make total sense to me. They turned their lives upside-down just to try and find something real. I wonder if they ever found itâ€“when I did, it scared the crap out of me.**

**The first Tinder girl I met in Utah was one of those â€œitâ€™s for a good causeâ€-type chicks. Iâ€™m not trying to offend anybody, itâ€™s just the only way I can think to describe her. What annoys me about those girls is that they all have the same personality. Theyâ€™re almost breathless to prove how angry they are about all the *right* things. It makes me feel like everything I know is wrong or something. You just sit there and listen and drown in their syndicated outrage. I swiped right for shallow reasons, yes. The messed-up thing is that I anticipated my annoyance as I glanced at her pics. I was shamelessly undeterred.**

**Her peach spaghetti-strap top swallowed most of my attention, even as she soliloquized about non binary love and dying pandas. (OK, I made that last one up.) Her blonde hair was pulled back in a ponytail. It was less a conversation and more a kind of reciting on her partâ€“anyone couldâ€™ve been sitting in front of her. I wonder if she wouldâ€™ve acted differently if she knew who I was. A few hours later, I finished softly somewhere in the bobbing bramble of hair in my lap. It was depressing. She fixed her ponytail in the mirror, checked her phone, then quickly left.**

**I donâ€™t usually let people get to know me too well, not even my bandmates. I mean we drop acid together sometimes, bro-bonding stuff, that kind of thing. Thatâ€™s about it. Even with girls, Iâ€™m a sex-in-the-dark kind of dude. They probably think Iâ€™m weird but I never ask. When the peach-top pedant was leaving I gave her one of our albums on cassette tape. It was awkward (â€œUh, thanksâ€¦?â€) but I feel like itâ€™s the best I can do.**

**Somewhere in the discussion of her saintly works, she had mentioned something her uncle had seen in a mall near downtown Salt Lake City. It was like an upright human with amphibian skin or something. Her uncle was a janitor who cleaned floors there late at night. The thing had come out of a basement stairwell, looked at him for a moment, then turned right back around and disappeared. The really crazy thing was that her uncle said he felt some kind of emotion deep in his chest that he never felt before, sort of like how you feel when you lock eyes with a stranger that looks inexplicably familiar. She reported all of this as a joke, rattling it off at blinding speed in her machine-gun dialogue of goodspeak. I couldnâ€™t stop thinking about it for the rest of the night, though, even when we started making out.**

**The guys in our band like to joke about the golden thumbâ€“itâ€™s when you start a streak of matching with the cityâ€™s hottest women. Thatâ€™s millennial serendipity at its finest. Isaac had the golden thumb in Topeka and we didnâ€™t see him until Michigan, but in Michigan the algorithms failed him. It works in mysterious ways. When I matched with this Clarissa girl from Provo, I decided Salt Lake City *was* a promised land, or at least my own Topeka. I had no idea what I was getting myself into, nor has that condition of not-knowing changed. But let me back up...**

**Clarissa was one of those one-pic profiles, which is risky. Youâ€™re betting that this single picture is so alluring that the opposite swiper needs no further proof of your hotness. In her case, it was a win. She was wearing a black romper striped orange, yellow, green; her hair was blue and cut boyishly short. The obligatory septum piercing made her nose look like a jewelled accessory. Style, attitude, cuteness. Bad-ass but delicate. The interesting part: the picture wasnâ€™t a picture but actually a moving boomerang, one of those images perpetually repeating two seconds of movement.**

**The boomerang showed Clarissa from behind, jogging in-place on a sidewalk with her face looking coyly back into the camera. I donâ€™t need to mention the advantages such an angle affords those of the requisite affinitiesâ€“but there was something else. Something *else.* There looked to be a kind of independent movement beneath the fabric around her tailbone, like an appendage that was rising and falling as she ran. You could *just* make out the outline. It couldnâ€™t beâ€¦**

**I put my phone away and started pumping some beat-mixes to get my mind straight. Things couldnâ€™t be *that* freaky in Utah. My headphones werenâ€™t loud enough to block out the image. The thing that bothered me most was that my attraction to her hadnâ€™t waned; if anything, I felt *more* attracted. Had I been watching too many shapeshifter animes? That was probably the case regardless.**

**Even so, there was no doubt that Clarissaâ€™s festive romper was hiding a full-grown tailâ€“like, none at all.Â  I watched the boomerang over and over again, turning my phone this way and that. There was no other conclusion. I considered calling my bandmates for brotherly support but in the end opted for privacy. Imagine if they heard I was seeing a girl with a *tail.* Literally a tail dangling down her rear. Her caption read: â€œWyoming-raised, Utah-grown. I donâ€™t want to go to Paris or Prague. Take me to a hidden place we can share secrets.â€ It was just too much.**

**The first time I met Clarissa it was somewhere near State St. Itâ€™s hard for me to keep track of the roads because theyâ€™re all numbered on a grid based on their proximity to the Mormon temple. Clarissa told me that this system makes it easier to get around and not get lost. She laughed when I disagreed. We ate vegan wraps in one of those generic Salt Lake plazas made of Mexican eateries and Asian stores. Clarissa explained that she ate healthy when it suited her schedule and mood, which made her â€œa seasonal veganâ€. It was summertime in Salt Lake; she wore a dirty-green tank-top and gray denim shorts ripped across the thighs; her hair was bluer than Freddie Mercuryâ€™s stage lighting.**

**She was one of those girls who was easy to talk to, but from whom you couldnâ€™t allow your attention to waver. Clarissa was no prolific talker. Instead I got a watchful loner vibe, someone youâ€™d see walking along deserted railroad tracks, someone who considered Bjork their private therapist. I kept imagining how I could bring the topic up without coming across as a total creep. â€œI didnâ€™t know people in Utah had tails...is that common here?â€ Gross. Maybe something more personal. â€œThat romper you had on does a lot for your tail.â€ God, no. I settled on: â€œCan you show me that running move from your profile?â€**

**We were walking along the sidewalks in the glow of the street lamps; night had fallen on the strange city made of numbers. Clarissaâ€™s hand was clasped softly in mine. I kept resisting the temptation to look behind her like an idiot. She was pressing me with questions somewhat absently. When I told her my bandâ€™s name was Nineteeneightyfornicate, she lost it and started going through all of our pictures on Instagram. That name was Isaacâ€™s idea, not mine! It did have a nice ring to it.**

**She stopped walking and turned on me suddenly.**

**â€œYou know, donâ€™t you?â€**

**â€œKnowâ€“know what?â€ I stammered lamely.**

**â€œOh come off the bullshit, man. Youâ€™ve known this whole time.â€ Staring me frankly in the eyes, she took my hand and ran it along something long, firm, cylindrical on her backside. My heartbeat quickened and a soft moan emitted from my throat. Clarissa giggled and threw my hand away.**

**â€œAny secrets youâ€™d like to share with me?â€**

**I looked at her for a second, processing. â€œI already told you my dirty band nameâ€“â€**

**â€œRight,â€ she scoffed. â€œI hope you come up with something better by tomorrow.â€**

**She turned and began receding into the jasmine-bordered shadows. I realized that we had been surrounded by cats ever since we started walking. They now trailed her in unison like a row of ducklings down the sidewalk.**

**â€œI DIDNâ€™T KNOW YOU WERE A CAT PERSON!â€ I yelled hopelessly.**

**She laughed and raised a long middle finger into the air without turning around. I sighed and began walking in the other direction back to my hotel. I opened my phone to a new text message from Clarissa. It didnâ€™t say anything; sheâ€™d only sent three cat emojis with their tails in the air. I marveled at how little I knew what in the hell was going on. *I just stroked a human tail. That really happened.* And yet, perversely, I couldnâ€™t wait for the next day.**

***....Any secrets youâ€™d like to share with meâ€¦***

**Iâ€™ll come cleanâ€“that night wasnâ€™t the first time I googled â€œhumans with tailsâ€. There had been drunken nights alone that I obsessed over the idea. My thoughts were ransacked by half-humanoids risen from primordial tetrapods, dripping with sea-foam and tails dragging in the sand. I told you I was a weird guy. To this point, the greatest harm all this had done was butcher my online algorithmsâ€“I would get ads for kinky Halloween costumes, which routinely raised some eyebrows.**

***She could be a government spy on some troll-job,* I thought to myself. The idea tormented me for several hours. What was worse, I thought, the CIA using search history and store-bought accessories to play with my mind, or the possibility that I had met some kind of hybrid human with a rope of flesh swinging from her backside? The little bit of ganja I had left made my speculations thicker and more confusing. She had to be real. Why would the government waste time mind-fucking a guy from a band named Nineteeneightyfornicate? I went from that to wondering what she ate when she was stoned.**

**Before I knew it, I was stepping out onto the curb in front of her house in my black knock-off Christian Diors. Who was this profane intruder in Provo? An agent *provo*cateur, I grinned to myself. I didnâ€™t know there could be neighborhoods with trees in the desert. Seemed like the Mormons were pretty good landscapers when they werenâ€™t busy granting all their wives eternal life. Who knew! Clarissa lived in a blue house with a quaint little front porch, one of those places that really has the picture-book mailbox with a perfect red lever pointed upwards.**

**â€œWere you tailing me earlier?â€**

**Clarissaâ€™s voice came out of nowhere, disembodied. I looked around me wildly, my unease ratcheting up several notches. A hand rested on my shoulder from behind; I wheeled around.**

**â€œChill out, freak,â€ Clarissa laughed. She looked at the tree next to her, brushing off some twigs. â€œMy nest is up *there*.â€**

**â€œYourâ€“nest?â€**

**â€œItâ€™s a joke, heard of those before?â€**

**I suddenly noticed she was wearing a yellow Walkman cassette player. We always BS that if we meet a chick with a portable cassette player, weâ€™ll automatically drop to one knee, no questions asked.**

**â€œSo youâ€™re that much of a dork that you listen to cassette tapes in 2020?!â€**

**â€œAnd youâ€™re telling me you donâ€™t have one on you right now?â€**

**Wordlessly, I raised my bandâ€™s cassette tape out of my pocket.**

**â€œGive me that,â€ she laughed, snatching it out of my hand. â€œMaybe we *are* a match!â€**

**I followed her inside.**

**â€œMy roommates are out for the weekendâ€â€“glancing at the couchâ€“â€you can just shove all that shit over, sorry. We have beer, lemonade, soda...or maybe you like the harder stuff?â€**

**I settled in and tried to relax, taking in what was around me. Nothing odd really. There was a crystal salt lamp whose warm glow looked afloat in the dim room. I could faintly sniff sage. A white cat met my gaze and darted out of sight, desperate to be forgotten.**

**â€œYou donâ€™t get many visitâ€“â€**

**The sentence was robbed from my throat. Clarissa was putting a glass of Jack Daniels on the table, naked beside the burgundy lingerie faintly interrupting her skin. I could see the thing in plain sightâ€“it was moving from side to side in a sort of carefree, feline attitude, *curling* back on itself this way and that, hairless and freckled as it tapered to its tip. It was a magnificent tail, too magnificent to be an accident. I closed my eyes and took a shot of the Jack.**

**â€œI know what youâ€™re thinking,â€ Clarissa smiled. She sat down next to me, running her hand along my shoulder. â€œYouâ€™re thinking â€˜itâ€™s impossible, this canâ€™t actually be happening.â€™â€**

**â€œYou must be psychic,â€ I shot back dryly.**

**â€œYouâ€™re thinking,â€ she pressed on, â€œthat science eliminates the possibility of my existence.â€**

**I didnâ€™t say anything.**

**â€œWhatâ€™s wrong, rock star, you donâ€™t want to play along? I know that you know it allâ€“how they say a human tail is only an abomination of the coccyx, a *vestige* of the behind that we all left behind...right?â€**

**â€œWhat are you getting at here, Clarissa?â€**

**She took a swig of lemonade and rolled the juice around her mouth, her gaze unbroken.**

**â€œNothing you havenâ€™t already thought of ten thousand times, but Iâ€™ll humor you. If the only reason humans donâ€™t have tails is because of some kind of disabled gene-signal, then the chances of more than one being on the planet is like one in billions. So if you realized there were *others like you*, that hypothesis would suddenly be on very thin ice.â€**

**My blood ran cold. I leaned all the way back on the sofa until my eyes were looking at the ceiling. The clustered nerve-endings were firing off in tingles that made it hard for me to resist the urge to let it squirm beneath me. All of my practiced methods for controlling the thing were failing. It was as if it somehow sensed another of its kind and now had license to awaken. Sheâ€™d caught me by the tail.**

**Clarissa leaned over me, her face close to mine. â€œShow it to me,â€ she whispered.**

**No one had set eyes on it outside of my parents; I hadnâ€™t seen them since they put me up for adoption. I sat up, pulled the back of my shirt up and leaned over. Her eyes felt like hot embers across its naked surface. She lifted it between her fingers, held it in her palm, caressed it. I suddenly noticed how heavily I was breathing.**

**â€œThere are many of us, you know,â€ she said softly.**

**â€œHow many?â€**

**Clarissa paused. â€œI donâ€™t know, to be honest. But a lot. I met them in the genetic labs outside Salt Lake.â€**

**â€œWait, geneticâ€“â€**

**â€œShhh!â€ She put a finger to my lips and straddled me, pulling my hands through her blue hair. â€œWeâ€™ll talk about it later.â€**

**I clutched her swaying tail and let its smoothness run through my fingers.**

**â€œWeâ€™re a match,â€ she giggled, â€œa match made in some dirty heaven.â€**

**That evening, for the first time in my life, I surrendered fully to whatever it is that I am. Clarissa hasnâ€™t left my side since; weâ€™re in Cheyenne now. Thereâ€™s not a day that goes by where I donâ€™t think: Iâ€™ve never been happierâ€“or more deeply, inconsolably frightened.**

title: Time management
body:
Recently, I read books on time management, and of course, I also read some articles about the use of time on the public account. After today, I summarize my reading experience.

Many people complain that they are too busy at the end of the day to find time to develop their hobbies and skills.Â In fact, when we remove most of the major time, we leave a fragment of time that is of great use.Â This fragmented time is often ignored and not used well.Â Fragmented time includes leisure time, time to play, and time to be used, such as waiting for the bus, queuing for receipts, and commuting time.Â There are also smaller chunks of fragmented time, such as waking up early and going to bed.

So how do you make the most of fragmentation time?Â Time management book, summed up this sentence;Â This means getting things done while everyone else is asleep and doing a few more things while everyone else is asleep.

Getting up early is a good living habit.Â There are many benefits to getting up early. In the book on effective learning, the human brain is most awake and efficient in the morning.Â So we can use this time to quietly and efficiently do what we love to do. It's best to split mental and physical exercise to start the day.Â Read, meditate, go for a run, write a morning journal, etc., instead of wasting time on your phone or sleeping in the comfy big bed.

Going to bed a little later is between 11:30 and 12:30, so when you're ready for bed, you can read a few more pages of a book, or listen to a favorite piece of music or listen to a foreign language.Â I now make it a point to do a daily review before I go to bed. I think about all the good things I did and the stupid things I did today. I also write down my to-do list for the next day and the good habits I want to stick to.

In my opinion, it is a waste of time to brush the mobile phone. Although the mobile phone has become an indispensable tool in our life, it is not only a simple communication tool, but also a medium to learn knowledge and expand the world.Â Even so, we shouldn't waste most of our day on our phones.Â The advice from the time management book is to turn your phone on silent when you're focused and check it every hour for about five minutes.

title: Article, believe in beauty
body:
